* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* Initializes the application and starts the interaction with the user.
* Initializes the required objects and loads up the data from the storage file.
// Set the model and start the TUI after JavaFX initialization is complete
* Represents an add command that adds a new task to the task list.
* The task to be added is specified by its type and details.

*

This class is responsible for executing the command to add a task to the
* task list, displaying the result to the user via the Tui.
* Constructs an {@code AddCommand} object with the specified task type and details.
* @param type    The type of the task to be added (e.g., TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT).
* @param details The details of the task to be added, such as description or due date.
* Executes the add command, adding a task to the given task list and displaying the result.
* @param list The task list where the task will be added.
* @param tui  The user interface that shows the result of the command execution.
* @throws StorageOperationException If there is an issue with saving the task to storage.
* @throws InsufficientInfoException If the task details provided are incomplete or invalid.
* @throws IllegalValueException     If the date time provided is not in correct format.
public String execute(TaskList list, Tui tui) throws StorageOperationException, InsufficientInfoException,
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed in the application.

*

Subclasses of this abstract class are required to implement the {@code execute} method,
* which defines the behavior when the command is executed on a given task list and user interface.

*

The {@code Command} class also includes a {@code isExit} method to check if the command is an exit command,
* which indicates when the application should terminate.
* {@code IllegalValueException}, and {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} can be thrown during command execution
* Executes the command using the provided {@code TaskList} and {@code Tui}.

*

This method should be implemented by subclasses to define the specific action
* that the command should perform, such as adding or deleting tasks.
* @param list The task list that the command operates on.
* @param tui   The user interface used to display the result of the command execution.
* @throws StorageOperationException If there is an issue with saving or loading tasks from storage.
* @throws InsufficientInfoException If there is insufficient information to execute the command.
* @throws IllegalValueException     If the command encounters invalid values or operations.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If an invalid index is used when accessing the task list.
public abstract String execute(TaskList list, Tui tui) throws StorageOperationException, InsufficientInfoException,
* Checks if this command is an {@code ExitCommand}, which signals the application to terminate.
* @return {@code true} if this is an exit command, {@code false} otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list by its index.

*

This class is responsible for executing the delete operation on the task list,
* removing a task based on its position in the list.

*

If the specified index is out of bounds, an {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} will be thrown.
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the specified index.

*

The index corresponds to the position of the task in the task list
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the specified index from the task list.

*

If the index is invalid, an {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} will be thrown.
* @param list The task list from which the task will be deleted.
* @param tui   The user interface that can display any necessary output after deletion.
* @throws StorageOperationException If there is an issue with the storage when deleting the task.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the specified index is out of bounds in the task list.
public String execute(TaskList list, Tui tui) throws StorageOperationException, IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Represents a command to list tasks from the task list.

*

The {@code ListCommand} can display all tasks in the task list, or if a specific
* {@code LocalDateTime} is provided, it will list tasks scheduled or ongoing on that date.

*

If no date is provided, all tasks in the list will be displayed.
* Constructs a {@code ListCommand} to list tasks scheduled on the given date.

*

If a {@code LocalDateTime} is provided, the command will filter and display
* only the tasks scheduled or ongoing on that date.
* @param dateTime The specific date and time to filter tasks by.
* Constructs a {@code ListCommand} to list all tasks.

*

Since no date is specified, the command will list all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by displaying tasks.

*

If a {@code dateTime} is specified, it will return tasks scheduled on that date.
* Otherwise, it will return all tasks in the task list.
* @param list The task list whose tasks will be displayed.
* @param tui   The user interface that shows the tasks.
public String execute(TaskList list, Tui tui) {
* Represents a command to mark or unmark a task's completion status in the task list.

*

The {@code MarkStatusCommand} can either mark a task as done or mark it as undone,

*

This command requires the task index to identify the task whose status will be updated.

If {@code isMarkCommand} is {@code true}, the task will be marked as done.

*

If {@code isMarkCommand} is {@code true}, the task at the specified index will
* be marked as done. Otherwise, it will be marked as undone.

* @param tui   The user interface to display the result of the command execution.
* @throws StorageOperationException If there is an issue with the storage during the operation.

* Represents the different types of tasks in the task management system.

*

The {@code TaskType} enum defines the various categories of tasks
* that can be managed within the application. Each type corresponds to
* a specific kind of task with distinct characteristics:

*
  • TODO: A simple task that needs to be done.

*
  • EVENT: A task that occurs at a specific time or within a time frame.

*
  • DEADLINE: A task that must be completed by a certain due date.

* A GUI for Mylo using FXML.

* Represents the text-based user interface for the Mylo application.
